result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:45 PM Defendant Evan Skylar Graham in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Evan Skylar Graham. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
Bail remains as fixed.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on October 31, 2022

ADDRESS INFO for Evan Skylar Graham
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: C/O Elise Beres  17535 Azure Ln, Brookfield, WI 53045

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A/co-defendant/Corey S. listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:24 PM Defendant Evan Skylar Graham in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Evan Skylar Graham. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Attorney Nimmer appears as friend of the court as they are still in the process of determining eligibility. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court notes that CCAP lists Count 4 as a Class D Felony but it is actually a Class H Felony. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
